content: the pridie collection one of a kind knitwear designs designer - christina pridie 432 rogers street peterborough ontario k9h 1w9 705-933-9276 email - pridiecollection@hotmail com website - www peterboroughyarnshop com poppy size - 2 1/2 inches in diameter materials - any red worsted weight yarn 4 grams 8 yds - 3 75 mm circular needles - 20 mm black button with 2 holes - tapestry needle - brooch pin optional - safety pin copyright - christina pridie - all rights reserved - 2022 1/3 instructions - read entire pattern over before starting special note - i am a seamless knitwear designer in both knitting and crocheting i design on the needles/hook so please treat each numbered row/round like a little task check it off when finished and then move on to the next row/round to complete your project i do not count the row/round on the needles in knitting unless otherwise stated this is so every skill level can enjoy doing my patterns abbreviations k - knit p - purl st s - stitch es rs - right side ws - wrong side k2tog - knit 2 together p2tog - purl 2 together cdd - center double decrease slip 2 sts off together knitwise insert left hand needle through the front of these 2 sts and at the same time insert the right hand needle into the first stitch on the left hand needle and knit these 3 stitches together poppy - is worked flat from the bottom up with 3 75 mm needles cast on 50 stitches using the long tail cast on technique and proceed as follows row 1 - ws k3 *p8 k4* repeat from *to* 2 more times p8 k3 includes selvage stitch at the beginning and end of row row 2 - rs p3 *k8 p4* repeat from *to* 2 more times k8 p3 row 3 - ws repeat row 1 row 4 - rs repeat row 2 row 5 - ws decrease row k1 k2tog *p2tog 4 times k2tog 2 times * repeat from *to* 2 more times p2tog 4 times k2tog k1- 26 sts row 6 - rs decrease row p1 *cdd* repeat from *to* to last st p1 - 10 sts cut yarn leaving a 12 inch tail with threaded tapestry needle draw yarn through remaining 10 sts leave this tail end to ws for now with beginning tail end mattress stitch seam closed put this tail end through the center hole to the ws of work at this point i like to take the other tail end and run it through the 10 stitches one more time to really secure and cinch the center in with one of the tail ends sew the button in the center of poppy tie both tail ends together and trim you can either hot glue gun or sew a brooch pin to the back of your poppy or use a simple safety pin to attach your poppy to the left side of your coat copyright
